label: neutral

text: Another interesting element was the latent patriotism that emerged during the Cup

text: Now this merits explaining: before the World Cup began, if you waved a German flag in the streets, you would probably be called a Nazi and at the very least labeled as a radical right wing nutter
label: neutral

label: neutral

text: But the general consensus after five weeks of debate was that the newfound national pride was a positive thing

text: But in order to recieve the blessing we must first realize that our emotions are always connected to a need being met or unmet
label: neutral

text: For instance, if I feel sad because I have not seen my family in a long time my need for connection has not been met
label: sad

text: On the otherhand, if I feel happy because I have spent time with my family then my need for connection has been met
label: happy

text: How many times have we felt angry and as a result insulted, judged, criticized, blamed or physically hurt someone?
label: angry

text: Probably too many to count
label: neutral

text: We live in a society that has encourages us to stuff our emotions and a society that is by the most part feelings illiterate
label: sad

text: We can become conscious of what is going on inside us
label: neutral

text: Once we put our finger on the emotion we are feeling we can then go on to vocalize it
label: neutral

text: Marshall Rosenberg, author of Nonviolent Communication, has a four-step process for communication that incorporates identifying our feelings and needs into the model
label: neutral

text: Part of that model involves asking the question, I am feeling _______ because I am needing ______
label: neutral

text: Rosenberg also calls this four step process giraffe language
label: neutral

text: He coined it giraffe language because the giraffe has the largest heart of all the mammals
label: neutral

text: The heart is about 3 feet long and 3 inches thick all around
label: neutral

text: The idea is that Nonviolent communication, which focuses on feelings and needs is the language of the heart because it focuses on what is alive in the heart
label: neutral

text: By stating our feelings and needs to others we avoid blaming and criticizing them
label: angry

text: We can then go on to making a request instead of a demand to help ourselves satisfy our now recognized need
label: neutral

text: When others are angry or upset with us we can also use this technique on them
label: angry

text: We can ask them, Are you feeling ______ because you are needing _______?
label: neutral

text: If we are not correct they will correct us and we will be closer to identifying the need they have and finding a way to resolve the situation
label: neutral

text: By satisfying our needs and the needs of others we can reach a fair negotiation
label: neutral

text: We can make a list of these feelings and be on the look out for them
label: neutral

text: It may be that we need to take a timeout when we feel these feelings to avoid a conflict
label: neutral

text: For instance, if we feel furious it may be better to take a one hour timeout and calm down
label: angry

text: Then when we are calm, focus on sharing our feelings and needs with others
label: neutral

text: Many times in the past we have reacted like a lion when we feel angry or frustrated with others or ourselves
label: angry

text: For more information on Nonviolent Communication click here

text: Actually, I think maybe the best thing about SPX is how everyone is kind of pressed together, comics placed near one another seemingly without much concern for subject matter coherency (I heard it was a bit different in prior years, with multiple selling rooms and all); if the creators in attendance and the books on display weren't a comprehensive picture of English-language non-superhero comics, there was at least enough diversity to manage the illusion of comprehensiveness
label: neutral

text: A diverse audience too, everything from young to old, from old-school nerds to stylish-looking folk, from aged hippies to teenage Goths

label: neutral

text: It's my world, a place where music in endless forms and varieties give me an entire lifetime of listening pleasure
label: happy

text: It's the oldest recognized type of music in Western civilization, and it dates back well into the Middle Ages
label: neutral

text: Since classical music is the oldest and largest genre of music in existence, let's study this music from one era to the next
label: neutral

text: Most music historians identify anywhere from four to seven distinct eras in classical music, and since I recognize all seven, let's learn about each one:
label: neutral

text: Our first composers were mostly supported by the church (surprise!), and religion influenced early classical music more than any other source
label: surprise

text: There was no formal system of notation, making composing very difficult and time-consuming
label: neutral

text: Gregorian chants were written during these ancient times
label: neutral

text: Renaissance (1450 - 1600): Humans discovered that Earth is not the center of the universe, so classical music changed along with the rest of the arts
label: neutral

text: Music became more of an expressive art than a science, and music was now being printed, allowing sacred, secular, and instrumental music to spread everywhere
label: neutral

text: Governments now influenced the spread of the era's music more than the church
label: neutral

text: Claudio Montiverdi was one of the most prominent composers of this era
label: neutral

text: Baroque (1600-1750): The era of Bach, Handel, and Vivaldi saw the development of almost every modern instrument in use today, particularly the violin, clarinet, and piano
label: neutral

text: Composers developed the idea of the sonata, the concerto, and the symphony, where great performers (called virtuosos) found enormous success
label: neutral

text: Think of this brief period as a launch platform of all the modern music to follow
label: neutral

text: Anyway, classical music wasn't even called classical music back in this time
label: neutral

text: You can find nearly all of the most popular composers in this era, namely Mozart and Beethoven (both of whom didn't know they were writing classical)
label: neutral

text: They used simple ideas, simple textures, and simple forms, all of which make for great listening material
label: neutral

text: Romantic (1825-1900): Lush and beautiful music was the prevailing theme during most of the 1800s, and music was written to tell stories, to depict the mysteries of nature, or to express the upper reaches of human emotions
label: neutral

text: Composers of this era such as Tchaikovsky, Brahms, and Chopin wrote music with a wider dynamic range, using a larger variety of instruments
label: neutral

text: Female composers gained more visibility during this period, such as Clara Schumann
label: neutral

text: New subcategories of classical music were born every year, and more composers were writing music than all previous eras combined
label: neutral

text: Music of this era was influenced by anything and everything, including world wars, politics, SEX, and cross-pollination by other types of music such as jazz
label: neutral

text: And anything and everything was possible, from atonal to experimental to electronic
label: neutral

text: Finally, music could be recorded and distributed widely, creating a burgeoning market for all types of new music
label: neutral

text: Over one hundred thousand composers fall into this period, including Copland, Stravinsky, and Ravel
label: neutral

text: Needless to say, neither the church nor the government contributed much to classical music in this century
label: neutral

text: Contemporary Classical: 1970 - 2050 (projected): If the 20th Century period ends in 1999, then what do we call all classical music written thereafter?
label: neutral

label: neutral
